author: @justsomeguy1408
text: In addition to the Excel skills mentioned in the video, I recommend becoming familiar with Power Query in Excel as well.   I work in an environment where I don't have access to a DBMS or Python, so I've been doing all of my analysis by writing SQL connections in Excel and then using Power Query for cleaning, transforming, and EDA (or pushing these into the SQL queries whenever possible).   It's very intuitive if you already understand SQL and Pandas, and you can do some pretty useful analysis with it.
